responsibilities: Collaborate with leadership team to define and execute a data testing strategy and plan
Design and implement a data validation framework
Partner with architects and developers to review architecture for testability and data quality
Provide coaching and technical guidance to junior data quality engineers
Act as a primary advocate and subject matter expert in data quality and drive awareness across cross-functional teams
Evaluate data testing tools and frameworks
Define and enforce testing and automation standards, processes, and metrics
Collect metrics to measure test progress and quality outcomes
skills: Experience with a modern data stack (Object stores like S3, Spark, Airflow, Lakehouse architectures, real-time databases, Glue, Athena, Sagemaker, Jupyter Notebook)
Experience with automated test tools (Great Expectations, Lambda test, Selenium, Cucumber, PyTest, Cypress)
Understanding of automation strategies & techniques for testing data, application, and CI/CD infrastructure
Strong desire and motivation to take up challenges and opportunities in a large and complex program
Demonstrates mutual respect, embraces diversity, equity, and inclusion, and acts with authenticity
analysis: The job responsibilities focus on data testing, validation, and quality assurance. The tasks include designing a data validation framework, collaborating with architects and developers, providing technical guidance, and evaluating data testing tools. The skills required include proficiency in Python, experience with a modern data stack, and knowledge of automated test tools and Big Data ecosystems. There is no mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is primarily on data quality and testing within a data engineering context.
